title: Google\Cloud\Optimization\V1\ShipmentModel\PrecedenceRule
name: PrecedenceRule
description:
A precedence rule between two events (each event is the pickup or the delivery of a shipment): the "second" event has to start at least offset_duration after "first" has started.

Several precedences can refer to the same (or related) events, e.g., "pickup of B happens after delivery of A" and "pickup of C happens after pickup of B". Furthermore, precedences only apply when both shipments are performed and are otherwise ignored.

Generated from protobuf message google.cloud.optimization.v1.ShipmentModel.PrecedenceRule

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

params.name: data.first_index
params.description: Shipment index of the "first" event. This field must be specified.

params.name: data.first_is_delivery
params.description: Indicates if the "first" event is a delivery.

params.name: data.second_index
params.description: Shipment index of the "second" event. This field must be specified.

params.name: data.second_is_delivery
params.description: Indicates if the "second" event is a delivery.

params.name: data.offset_duration
params.description: The offset between the "first" and "second" event. It can be negative.
